input_text:
Job Title: Director, Cloud Operations

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Management

Description:
Job DescriptionThe Director, Cloud Operations provides critical value to the operations of Advantive. This leader will have oversight over the strategy and management of Cloud operations inclusive of implementation, standardization, optimization and management of Engineering and Cloud infrastructure services along with leading the cloud integration of newly acquired business.The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience leading and transforming cloud operations with a focus on delivering top-tier clouds capabilities, creating state-of-the-art tooling, enabling robust cloud infrastructure solutions, and emphasizing efficiency, cost optimization, consolidating cloud footprints, compliance, and building strong relationships with both top-tier cloud services providers such as AWS and Azure, as well as next tier specialized cloud providers. Preference will be given to candidates living within proximity to Tampa, Florida, but consideration will be given to any highly qualified candidate accustomed to working within the hours of the Eastern Time Zone.Objectives and ResponsibilitiesThe primary duties of the Director, Cloud Operations consist of the following:Strategic Leadership and Vision: Align and partner with the development, IT operations and security teams, as well as the product, sales, customer success and support groups on a cloud strategy that integrates business goals, efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and complianceGuide the CloudOps team to operational excellence and continuous improvement in cloud service deliveryCloud as a Service Delivery: Manage robust, scalable, and cost-efficient Cloud as a TTV (Time-To-Value) Service offerings, focused on infrastructure, deployment and tooling. Ensure high availability, performance, security, and cost-effectiveness of the cloud infrastructureCloud as a Support: Direct and oversee cloud support for internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal PEQs and OLA measuresManagement of cloud infrastructure, server systems, storage, virtualization/containerization and infrastructure as a code developmentEfficiency and Cost Optimization: Strategically optimize cloud resources and spending. Implement cost-saving strategies and efficient resource utilization methodologies. Provide expertise on efficiency and cost management to internal stakeholdersCompliance and Auditor Interaction: Ensure adherence to compliance standards and regulatory requirements. Actively engage with auditors, manage compliance audits, and incorporate compliance requirements into cloud operationsOwning Cloud Service Provider Relationship through 3rd Party: Build and maintain a strong relationship with AWS and Azure through a 3rd party servicing provider. Manage the partnership to leverage the best services, support, and pricing for AdvantiveCapability and Capacity Building: Develop enduring capabilities in the team through building bootcamps, training, mentoring, and hiring top talent at onsite or at offshore entities. Cultivate a culture of innovation, collaboration, technical and financial excellenceBudget Management and Financial Reporting: Oversee cloud-related budgets, conduct financial analysis, and report on efficiencies and cost savings. Implement financial controls for optimal cloud spending managementIncident Management and Compliance: Maintain robust incident management processes and ensure compliance with relevant regulations, standards and controlsBuild strategic relationships across business lines to anticipate the needs and preempt the risks encountered by company stakeholders by bridging the understanding of technical and non-technical requirements, understanding business goals, identifying business process gaps and proposing solutionsSupport disaster recovery and business continuity efforts by contributing to the development of Business Continuity PlanEnsure team cohesion and alignment through standing meeting cadence and action-oriented agendas and outcomesEstablish goals (P’s & C’s) for CloudOps department, develop team competencies and manage their performance on an ongoing basis; offer employees ongoing support and coaching to maximize team engagement and performanceTo perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following behaviors: Business Acumen: Command of fundamental elements of business operations including budget administration and forecasting, capacity planning, and data analytics Discipline and Perseverance: Focus and commitment to solving complex issues through to completion Effective Communication: Strong written and oral communication skills Excellent Time Management: a proven ability to embrace a sense of urgency to prioritize tasks Flexibility and Hard Work: Operate in a fast-paced and iterative environment while adapting to new technologies Leadership: Strong interpersonal skills, performance management, and staff interaction to inspire and lead high performance in challenging circumstances Problem-Solving: Strong critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities Quality: Dedicated to producing high-quality product deployment and hosting best practices Self-Improvement: actively self-improves through individual learning, coursework, or otherwiseTeamwork: Communicate effectively and operate collaboratively within a team environment Skills & Other RequirementsSkills & Other RequirementsMinimum of ten (10) years of relevant professional experience in IT, cloud operations or related fields including five (5) years of management experience Specific Cloud Experience: at least 5-7 years of experience should be directly related to cloud computing, such as hands-on experience with cloud services (like AWS, Azure, GCP), cloud architecture, and cloud service managementLeadership Experience: Candidates should also have substantial experience (5+ years of experience) in leadership or management roles, overseeing teams, projects, or departments related to cloud operations, IT infrastructure, or similar areasDemonstrated ability to communicate with technical and non-technical staff across multiple disciplines and hierarchical levels within the companyProven experience in a senior cloud operations role, with a focus on efficiency, cost optimization, compliance, and strong vendor relationshipsDemonstrable AWS cloud computing experience at scale, utilizing multiple AWS primitives, infrastructure as code, automation tools, and financial managementStrong planning, project management, and financial acumenDemonstrably sustained embodiment of company values involving Drive to Excellence, Grit, Humility, Integrity, Results Orientation, and Winning AttitudeBachelor’s degree in computer science or information technology discipline highly desiredDesired Competencies: Strong organizational/collaborative leadership and change management experience Highly developed written and verbal communication skills Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to convey and implement a vision for Cloud that will sustain the company’s immediate and long-term goalsTravel up to 10% for individuals not in the vicinity of Tampa, Florida

other.content: Minimum of ten (10) years of relevant professional experience in IT, cloud operations, or related fields including five (5) years of management experience. Specific Cloud Experience: at least 5-7 years of experience should be directly related to cloud computing, such as hands-on experience with cloud services (like AWS, Azure, GCP), cloud architecture, and cloud service management. Leadership Experience: Candidates should also have substantial experience (5+ years of experience) in leadership or management roles, overseeing teams, projects, or departments related to cloud operations, IT infrastructure, or similar areas. Demonstrated ability to communicate with technical and non-technical staff across multiple disciplines and hierarchical levels within the company. Proven experience in a senior cloud operations role, with a focus on efficiency, cost optimization, compliance, and strong vendor relationships. Demonstrable AWS cloud computing experience at scale, utilizing multiple AWS primitives, infrastructure as code, automation tools, and financial management. Strong planning, project management, and financial acumen. Demonstrably sustained embodiment of company values involving Drive to Excellence, Grit, Humility, Integrity, Results Orientation, and Winning Attitude. Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information technology discipline highly desired. Desired Competencies: Strong organizational/collaborative leadership and change management experience. Highly developed written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to convey and implement a vision for Cloud that will sustain the company’s immediate and long-term goals.
